result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo Ellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Lorenzo Ellis in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for modification of sentence: Defense counsel is requesting that the release date for his client be today. State leaves it up to the court and makes no arguments. Court grants the defense Motion and the defendant's sentence to be concluded today and defendant may be released.
Motion hearing at 02-05-2016 01:30 pm
Motion to Modify Sentence

Sentence reconsideration request filed by Attorney Schleis

Reviewed by Judge Maxwell 1/29/16
Court's response denying defendant's request for sentence reduction

Special Request for Sentence Reduction filed by defendant.

Denied by Judge Maxwell 1/11/16
Defendant's Huber privileges are hereby revoked for the balance of the defendant's sentence.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lorenzo Ellis in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1 with the repeater struck and pleads guilty to count #2 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts #1 and 2 with the repeaters struck.  Count # 3, case # 15CM628, and case # 15CM629 are dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count 1     
Sentence of:
4 months Huber consecutive to count #2  (Credit - 12 days) HUBER WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.

Costs: $253.00 
 (To be paid at the rate of $25.00  per month commencing 1/1/2016 .  Failure to pay; the Court orders 5 days Jail as contempt for non-compliance with Court Order).

The Court Orders the Following:
Count 2     
Sentence of:
4 months Huber consecutive (Credit - 0 days) HUBER WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.
Costs: $243.00
 (To be paid at the rate of $25.00  per month commencing 1/1/2016 .  Failure to pay; the Court orders 5 days Jail as contempt for non-compliance with Court Order).
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-23-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Lorenzo Ellis in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests an immediate plea and sentencing date. Court grants.
Attorney Schleis requests the Court order the Waukesha County Jail to provide a reason why the defendant is in lock-down for reasons stated on the record. Defense requests an expediated evaluation of his status. 
Court declines to order the jail to provide this information. 
Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 09-17-2015 10:30 am
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/ listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant to have no contact with any Brookfield Square Mall
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Lorenzo Ellis in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Schleis stated the defendant has been in solitary confinement. Court does not address the issue and take it up with the administration.  Hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.
